alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Henderson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 2:48PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Henderson and central Decatur Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 248 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Reagan, or 10 miles southeast of Lexington, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Parsons, Decaturville, Reagan, Darden, Scotts Hill, Lick Skillet, Perryville, Busseltown, Warrens Bluff, Wilkinstown, Rock Hill, Mount Tabor, Garrett, Beacon, Hickory Forks, Largo, Taylors Crossing, Cozette and Shady Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west Tennessee. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for west Tennessee.
